item.title: Meri add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Meri add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Meri add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Meri add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Meri add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Meri add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Meri add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Meri add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Tell people there's an invisible man in the sky who created the universe, and the vast majority will believe you. Tell them the paint is wet, and they have to touch it to be sure." -- George Carlin

item.title: Meri add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "You know how it is when you're reading a book and falling asleep, you're reading, reading... and all of a sudden you notice your eyes are closed? I'm like that all the time." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Meri add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Meri add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Meri add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them. In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Meri add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I feel thin, sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Meri add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Meri add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Meri add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Meri add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Meri add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Meri add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Meri add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: Meri add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is no sin except stupidity." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Meri add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Meri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Meri add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Meri add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Meri add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "A joker is a little fool who is different from everyone else. He's not a club, diamond, heart, or spade. He's not an eight or a nine, a king or a jack. He is an outsider. He is placed in the same pack as the other cards, but he doesn't belong there. Therefore, he can be removed without anybody missing him." -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Meri add a quote by D. H. Lawrence
item.description: "Perhaps only people who are capable of real togetherness have that look of being alone in the universe. The others have a certain stickiness, they stick to the mass." -- D. H. Lawrence

item.title: Meri add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Even the company of the mad was better than the company of the dead." -- Stephen King

item.title: Meri add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Meri add a quote by Anton LaVey
item.description: "Stupidity—The top of the list for Satanic Sins. The Cardinal Sin of Satanism. It’s too bad that stupidity isn’t painful. Ignorance is one thing, but our society thrives increasingly on stupidity. It depends on people going along with whatever they are told. The media promotes a cultivated stupidity as a posture that is not only acceptable but laudable. Satanists must learn to see through the tricks and cannot afford to be stupid." -- Anton LaVey
